description: I am tasked with effectively developing and leading SIGINT training for civilian as well as military personnel. I have designed and implemented initial as well as on-the-job training and specialty classroom instruction that has resulted in improving mission productivity by 30%. I have developed a marketing program that produced crucial reports on the success and impact of TSA activities. These reports had a positive effect on multiple customers which resulted in increasing funding as well as personnel to support the organizational mission. As TSA Compliance Officer I successful ensure that multiple-site operations comply with all relevant NSA security guidelines and standards, and I provide continual monitoring of performance of Intelligence Oversight Officers.

description: In this assignment, I employed my leadership strengths in managing the performance of military, contractor and Coalition Forces to provide tactical SIGINT for CENTCOM TSA. I was the mission director and strategic planner and continually used my skills in process management, language processing and assessing of near-real-time threats. I developed crucial relevant reports and provided exceptional direct support for commanders working in force protection. As Intelligence Oversight Officer I ensured that there were zero security violations during the production and reporting of SIGINT as well as the foreign release of major products.

description: I was tasked with leading the joint participation of military, civilian and coalition personnel in providing primary SIGINT unit support in the CENTCOM theater. My responsibilities included managing three Information Technology contracts, projects and operations. I oversaw a 210% increase in Branch production resulting in highly positive operational effects. I also carefully reviewed and edited any reports concerning theater-wide operations that were going to be used for foreign release, ensuring the highest levels of quality control of all disseminated intelligence. Additionally, I was responsible for developing and implementing policies regarding near-real-time sensitive intelligence and SIGINT reports used by the U.S. and other partners.

description: I oversaw a high-value SIGINT tool development program that utilized the skills of a specialized team of civilian and military personnel in providing enhanced force protection analysis for multiple combat units. Our team focused on insurgent activities, TIPs, technologies and countermeasures leading to 24/7 warnings and threat protection capabilities against specific weapons systems for U.S. and Coalition Forces. I also developed various procedures and in-depth analysis that defeated insurgent networks and led to the capture of insurgents and their support personnel. I designed and implemented the use of a framework that saved multiple thousands of dollars in managing billets and developed a cell with the Directorate the focused on global level to defeat a deadly weapon. I also developed a training program to support a SIGINT analyst scheduled to deploy to the CENTCOM AOR.

description: I directed on-the-job cryptologic training for 3,000 military, DOD civilians and contract personnel. I authored extensive NSAG operational instructions for directors of the Signals Intelligence Directorate (SID) and the Associate Directorate of Education and Training (ADET) in order to increase the value as well as prioritize and streamline site training standards. Additionally, as Project Manager, I evaluated the competency management process for the NSAG civilian workers and developed and implemented a large number of positive recommendations. These actions resulted in reducing expenditures as well as non-productive work hours. The SIGINT activities resulted in the development of more than 50 separate Operational Duty Position JQS programs covering intelligence positions with the NSAG and the increase in SIGINT production for deployed units.

description: I was chosen over four senior supervisors to serve as Program Manager for 90 days, with responsibilities for mentoring two interns and coordinating two advanced signal analysis classes; six participants successfully graduated. I was personally selected to developing the signals analysis training program for 500+ military and civilian personnel at the Signals Intelligence Directorate at the NSAW. I was the first program participant out of 30 to be designated as a professional COMINT Analyst and to be certified as an Advanced Signals Analyst. While at the Signals Survey & Analysis Branch I was selected to work on the high-priority signal and directed the work of two analysts in developing methods for deciphering and exploiting the signal. I successfully designed an advanced signaling system that contained key information leading to increased coverage of high-value targets. Additionally, at a signal analyst conference, I led a discussion and training activity concerning high priority signals. While an analyst at NSA Information Systems, I produced a 100-page Informal Technical Note (ITN) identifying more than ten unknown data types. This ITN was nominated as the William Hunt Technical Paper of the Year. Additionally, I served as an Adjunct Faculty Instructor where I taught Signals Analysis and Measurement techniques to 12 foreign national personnel. These capabilities were acknowledged with excellent responses and ratings. Also, while I was working at a branch of the Signals Intelligence Directorate I was responsible for instructing on communications signals and analysis techniques, which was a four course per year schedule.

description: Mr. Foster is a self employed SIGINT specialist with 48+ years of operational experience and one who still enjoys sharing his knowledge with those who may be in need of his expertise on a part-time basis or on a short term full-time project or task basis. He is a graduate of the Federal Leadership Institute in Shepherdstown, WV; NSAâ€™s Management Development Program and holds a degree in General Education from Central Texas College. Mr. Foster also holds a Masters Title in the Cryptologic Access Skill Field and is an Adjunct Faculty Member with the National Cryptologic School.

description: Mr. Foster joined the National Security Agency in 1985 and held numerous technical and management positions as an operations officer for new systems development and deployment and served on many SIGINT planning groups over his 27 year career at the agency. In his most recent assignments before retiring, he served as the Technical Director for the National SIGINT Collection Center, Chief of the Antenna & Spectrum Engineering division, Link Access Programs Technical Leader to the Real Time Regional Gateway (RTRG) program office and his final position as Chief, Systems & Engineering Staff, Global Access Operations (GAO).

description: Mr. Foster began his Signals Intelligence career in 1964 with the Army Security Agency (ASA) and completed it with its successor organization, the Intelligence and Security Command (INSCOM) in 1985. He served as an Army collection operator and signals analyst for 16 years before being appointed as a Chief Warrant Officer; serving as a Signals Collection Officer and an INSCOM Systems Manager. Mr. Foster served overseas for 14 years at various U.S. Army field stations including Sinop, Turkey; Hakata, Japan; Augsburg, Germany; Shemya, Alaska; and West Berlin from 1979-1984. He retired in 1985 while serving at INSCOM Headquarters in Arlington, VA as the INSCOM Systems Manager for programs scheduled for deployment to Field Station Berlin.

description: Indoctrinated in to the National Security Agency January 2008. Assisted in quality control on mission critical reports in support of Operation ENDURING FREEDOM. Senior SGA analyst solely responsible for the detailed documentation of targets of interest telecommunications network. Developed network analysis to locate and identify targets of interest. Provided imagery used to identify and understand the telecommunication infrastructure and technologies used by a variety of targets of interest. Produced reporting and imagery to enable sustained collection and provide and intelligence through product reports, Requests for Information (RFI), and appropriate databases. Oversaw the Division-level digital network mission while actively engaging forward deployed elements, and supporting unit leaders and commanders with constant analysis of target communication in support of Operation IRAQI FREEDOM. description: Special Access Program Manager Managed all facets of mission planning, personnel training, manning, budget management, schedule management and logistics for a Special Projects Collection team. Organizational liaison and representative for multiple special access teams. Coordinated and provided specialized tailored operational support that ensured National objects were met. Satisfied collection requirements and priorities impacting Fleet and National objectives. Worked with TOPI and multiple agencies on RFI ensuring complete target information availability. Responsible for acquisition planning, procurement (initiating/tracking) documentation, and budgetary issues. Expertly interfaced with contractor facility through the development, testing, acceptance, and integration of two $1.2M Electronic Support Suites on a special platform. Accountable for drafting and reviewing Statements of Work and Memorandums of Understanding. Certified and accredited two unique Electronic Support Suite as fully mission capable. Provided recommendation on equipment, technical and operational input to system engineers, identifying software problems and equipment shortcomings prior to equipment delivery. Led multiple member teams in performing post-mission system evaluations, testing and on site inspections for an upgraded unique collection suite.

description: National Security Agency, Texas - Deputy Director for Signals Intelligence, Defense Intelligence Senior Executive, 2006-2011: Led end-to-end full spectrum SIGINT operations, from requirements, to discovery and development, to data acquisition, to analysis/production, to delivery and customer interaction by more than a thousand U.S. and partner civilian and military cryptologic professionals. Joint Duty qualified and certified as an Intelligence Community Officer. National Security Agency - Deputy Global Capabilities Manager, International Security Issues, GS-15, 2005-2006: Led production and delivery, resource allocation, budgeting, assessment, and customer engagement for major analysis and production organization within the Signals Intelligence Directorate. National Security Agency - Issue Manager, GS-15, 2003-2005: Served as the analysis and production lead on a three-person team responsible to the Director, NSA, for optimizing Global War On Terrorism support simultaneously to national policymakers and military combatant commands. Team conceived and implemented Cryptologic Support Teams (CST) to extend national reach to, and reach-back from, the Brigade Combat Team level, resulting in significant numbers of enemy combatant capture/kills, as well as U.S. and coalition casualties avoided.

description: National Security Agency - Chief of Operations, Special U.S. Liaison Officer London (SUSLOL) GS-14, 1999-2002: Managed SIGINT requirements and delivery to U.S. Embassy customers, including the Ambassador, Deputy Chief of Mission, Consul General, Chief of Station, and over 25 departments and agencies across the U.S. Government. Briefed and interacted with senior members of the USG regularly. Represented the SUSLOL to all U.S. cryptologic activities in the UK. Managed and served as SAP cryptologic interlocutor with DoD, UK MOD, Cabinet Office, and GCHQ. Collaborated extensively with U.S. and UK intelligence and law enforcement agencies post 9-11. National Security Agency, 1980-1999: Initial employment as a Russian linguist, leading to increasing levels of technical and managerial responsibility. Served within the Office of Corporate Relations during the transition to the Clinton Administration. Responsible for outreach to the Intelligence Community to educate new Administration officials in NSA/CSS capabilities; brought many officials for day-long orientations and/or briefings, including the DCI, Attorney General, NIC Chairman, and others. Served in the Office of Policy as primary staffer in support of the Chairman of the National SIGINT Committee, researching, drafting and coordinating SIGINT policy memoranda.

description: National Security Agency, Texas - Deputy Director for Signals Intelligence, Defense Intelligence Senior Executive, 2006-2011: Led end-to-end full spectrum SIGINT operations, from requirements, to discovery and development, to data acquisition, to analysis/production, to delivery and customer interaction by more than a thousand U.S. and partner civilian and military cryptologic professionals. Joint Duty qualified and certified as an Intelligence Community Officer. National Security Agency - Deputy Global Capabilities Manager, International Security Issues, GS-15, 2005-2006: Led production and delivery, resource allocation, budgeting, assessment, and customer engagement for major analysis and production organization within the Signals Intelligence Directorate. National Security Agency - Issue Manager, GS-15, 2003-2005: Served as the analysis and production lead on a three-person team responsible to the Director, NSA, for optimizing Global War On Terrorism support simultaneously to national policymakers and military combatant commands. Team conceived and implemented Cryptologic Support Teams (CST) to extend national reach to, and reach-back from, the Brigade Combat Team level, resulting in significant numbers of enemy combatant capture/kills, as well as U.S. and coalition casualties avoided.

description: National Security Agency - Chief of Operations, Special U.S. Liaison Officer London (SUSLOL) GS-14, 1999-2002: Managed SIGINT requirements and delivery to U.S. Embassy customers, including the Ambassador, Deputy Chief of Mission, Consul General, Chief of Station, and over 25 departments and agencies across the U.S. Government. Briefed and interacted with senior members of the USG regularly. Represented the SUSLOL to all U.S. cryptologic activities in the UK. Managed and served as SAP cryptologic interlocutor with DoD, UK MOD, Cabinet Office, and GCHQ. Collaborated extensively with U.S. and UK intelligence and law enforcement agencies post 9-11. National Security Agency, 1980-1999: Initial employment as a Russian linguist, leading to increasing levels of technical and managerial responsibility. Served within the Office of Corporate Relations during the transition to the Clinton Administration. Responsible for outreach to the Intelligence Community to educate new Administration officials in NSA/CSS capabilities; brought many officials for day-long orientations and/or briefings, including the DCI, Attorney General, NIC Chairman, and others. Served in the Office of Policy as primary staffer in support of the Chairman of the National SIGINT Committee, researching, drafting and coordinating SIGINT policy memoranda.

description: â€¢ Led an effort or processing countless indication and warning alerts, increasing productivity by over 40 percent. â€¢ Managed Electronic Intelligence (ELINT) analysis in support of several major theater missions constantly contributing to national situational awareness. â€¢ Composed and transmitted time sensitive ELINT summary reports to the All Source Fusion Section, ensuring that all on and off theater assets received timely, accurate intelligence. â€¢ Authored several Job qualifications standards guides for TENCAP for new personnel to reduce management to employee interrogational by 75 percent. â€¢ Gathered data which was typically pertinent to the electronics of a targetâ€™s defense network, especially the electronic parts such as radars, surface-to-air missile systems, aircraft, etc. â€¢ Performed Signals Identification by analyzing the collected parameters of a specific signal, and either matching it to known criteria, or recording it as a possible new emitter increasing the accuracy in reporting by 30 percent. â€¢ Managed a team of analyst that managed an Electronic Order of Battle, which required tremendous knowledge of Electronic Intelligence for the identification of Signals Intelligence (SIGINT) emitters in an area of interest, determining their geographic location or range of mobility, characterizing their signals, and where possible, determining their role in the broader organizational order of battle.

description: -Digital Network Lead Analyst/Tailored Access Operations Liaison in the Signals Intelligence Directorate since April 2008. Team chief since June 2009. Led efforts to utilize new skills and tools to achieve high priority objectives. -Direct and manage information and workflow throughout the team to ensure timelessness of reporting, including monitoring the criteria for the selection of reportable intelligence. -Spearheaded planning the future development of targets; provided guidance and leadership for organizational changes and challenges. Served as key facilitator of communication within the team as a spokesperson for the team and branch. -Interfaced with Intelligence Community components and provided customer support and accurately represented NSA capabilities. -Developed and led Computer Network Operations (CNO) to obtain strategic and actionable foreign intelligence and facilitated network warfare. Directly impacted U.S. national intelligence policy and directives to track and thwart WMD programs. -Subject Matter Expert Reporter on Middle East and North Africa targets, to include fast-paced work environments, worked under strict deadlines as well as advanced analytical assessment reports. Authored, edited, and released SIGINT intelligence reports and assessments to include mentoring several less experienced employees while producing products in accordance with relevant policies and procedures. -Graduate of the Intelligence Analysis Development Program (IADP), a robust three-year training program after completing 800 hours of training and five unique Signals Intelligence tours covering a variety of skills and job junctions to include intelligence reporting, social network analysis, advanced research, signals development, and computer network operations. -Specialization and target expertise in Middle Eastern and Combating Proliferation target sets. -completed training courses in cell technology, Network+ bootamp, TCP/IP Networking as well as a variety of classes.

description: Performed in-depth analysis on a wide variety of highly technical and multi-faceted projects and issues of interest to national-level policy makers as well as engineers involved in research and development of communications equipment. Evaluate global network systems, software, hardware and other aspects associated with emerging technologies. Study and evaluate communications infrastructures and capabilities. Exclusive programmer and administrator of virtual Apache web servers for two diverse branches in division.

description: Analyzed, recorded, organized, and documented findings on sensitive data in support of multiple branches of the Signals Intelligence Directorate at NSA Georgia. Used advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel to import and manipulate large data sets, and used pivot tables to present information in a clear and effective manner. Extensively used Microsoft PowerPoint to aid in the presentation of graphics and data charts to convey important information to key decision-makers. Prioritized and worked on multiple projects concurrently, using excellent multitasking skills to ensure that all deadlines were met. Provided training on advanced analytic principles and new or changing methodologies for over a dozen military and Department of Defense personnel. Acted as Team Lead for over ten analysts during supervisorâ€™s periods of absence. Despite initially being lower-ranking than several other team members, was trusted to ensure that project deadlines were met and that the overall efficiency and productivity of the team did not waver. Maintained good verbal and written communication with other team members and analysts in order to achieve the most complete, thorough, and detailed results possible. Contributed to the development of a Job Qualification Standards program for Intelligence Analysts within the branch. Used experience and training skills, as well as extensive collaboration among team members to help create a complete, efficient, and effective training program. Completed Enlisted Information Dominance Warfare Specialist qualification within the US Navy intelligence community. Qualification entailed over 320 hours of study as well as a rigorous board process before senior members of the community in order to demonstrate working knowledge of information and concepts relevant to the intelligence community at large.

description: Coordinates the deployment and sustainment of National Security Agency (NSA) representation elements to Joint Task Forces, interagency elements, and other military commands conducting contingency operations. Serves as the single point of contact for all Central Command current operations and deployed Officer in Charge (OIC) and analyst positions. Maintains oversight of integration/reception and management of all personnel; staff and deployers. Prioritizes actions, provides guidance, and maintains visibility on all policy issues and actions. Aids the Branch Chief in setting the strategic short term and long-term goals for the branch.

description: Battalion Intelligence Officer/Security Manager for the XVIII Airborne Corps' Multiple Launch Rocket System (MLRS) battalion, capable of deploying in support of short or no-notice, global contingency missions. Responsible for synchronizing the deployment and employment of 425 soldiers and over 200 pieces of equipment. Primary duties included: generating enemy scenarios, intelligence data, and intelligence summaries during training; collecting, analyzing, and disseminating intelligence to subordinate units during wartime; security management and safety. Additionally served as the battalion anti-terrorism/force protection officer responsible for developing force protection plans, instructing and coordinating annual training requirements, and serving as the primary advisor to the Battalion Commander.

description: -Digital Network Lead Analyst/Tailored Access Operations Liaison in the Signals Intelligence Directorate since April 2008. Team chief since June 2009. Led efforts to utilize new skills and tools to achieve high priority objectives. -Direct and manage information and workflow throughout the team to ensure timelessness of reporting, including monitoring the criteria for the selection of reportable intelligence. -Spearheaded planning the future development of targets; provided guidance and leadership for organizational changes and challenges. Served as key facilitator of communication within the team as a spokesperson for the team and branch. -Interfaced with Intelligence Community components and provided customer support and accurately represented NSA capabilities. -Developed and led Computer Network Operations (CNO) to obtain strategic and actionable foreign intelligence and facilitated network warfare. Directly impacted U.S. national intelligence policy and directives to track and thwart WMD programs. -Subject Matter Expert Reporter on Middle East and North Africa targets, to include fast-paced work environments, worked under strict deadlines as well as advanced analytical assessment reports. Authored, edited, and released SIGINT intelligence reports and assessments to include mentoring several less experienced employees while producing products in accordance with relevant policies and procedures. -Graduate of the Intelligence Analysis Development Program (IADP), a robust three-year training program after completing 800 hours of training and five unique Signals Intelligence tours covering a variety of skills and job junctions to include intelligence reporting, social network analysis, advanced research, signals development, and computer network operations. -Specialization and target expertise in Middle Eastern and Combating Proliferation target sets. -completed training courses in cell technology, Network+ bootamp, TCP/IP Networking as well as a variety of classes.

description: Acted as the lead and technical authority for the integration of Air Force and Department of Defense intelligence systems and communications into the Air National Guard units Interfaced with Higher Air Force, Major Commands, National Guard Bureau and Air National Guard staffs, and operational field units to synchronize and coordinate current and future Air National Guard intelligence surveillance and reconnaissance system installation and capabilities Prepared background materials, assessments and analysis on Air National Guard intelligence surveillance and reconnaissance system acquisition and integration programs and activities for the National Guard Bureau staff Researched, analyzed and develop mission specific equipment requirements for cyber intelligence surveillance and reconnaissance and targeting units. Requirements included the identification of communication and infrastructure equipment Conducted site assist visit to transitioning Cyber intelligence surveillance and reconnaissance units, identified necessary mission essential actions required to establish baseline mission equipment and communication requirements

description: Directs and leads a specialized direct support team conducting operations world-wide. Directs and maintains watch center; manages and evaluates subordinates; prepares written evaluation reports; develops technical manuals; prepares requests for activation or deactivation of communications networks; allocates and tasks manpower assets to complete work load; directs safety program and maintenance program in work area. Officer Technical specialist in all phases of operations conducted by Naval Information Operations Command, including signals intelligence, signals security, and electronic warfare; responsible for administration, personnel support, electronic maintenance, communications, and technical research in support of operating forces and the national cryptologic effort. Provides overall technical supervision in accordance with appropriate directives required in employment of equipment and manpower resources; supervises the installation, maintenance and operation of electrical, electromechanical, and electronic equipment; directs the conduct of communications, administrative, and communications security functions; writes technical report and personnel evaluation reports.

description: Senior Expert on the development of communications electronic attack techniques. Supervised and managed over 15 member team on the production, testing and delivery of the most advanced techniques to the U.S. Naval fleet. Lead assessor of communications electronic attack training and assist visits. Instructed all levels of the chain of command on the use and operation of communications electronic attack equipment and techniques. Ensured units ability successfully accomplish mission tasking. Provided Special Technical Operations planning support to the inaugural Joint Cyber Operations Task Force during Terminal Fury-10. Instrumental in ensuring mission accomplishment by providing guidance and de-confliction duties during cyber operations.

description: Obtained Sensitive Compartmented Information Facility accreditation for new construction facility to accomplish required for mission objectives. Directed all administrative, physical security sanitation actions necessary to obtain the de-accreditation certification for a Sensitive Compartmented Information facility. Obtained de-accreditation with zero discrepancies. Obtained Special Access Program Facility accreditation for new construction facility required to accomplish mission. Ensured accreditation was in accordance with all applicable Joint Army Navy Air Force regulations. Responsible for the daily operations of the Special Access Program Facility.

description: Supervises and manages Naval Information Warfare personnel and resources assigned to fleet surface unit for the provision of direct to the operational commander in the areas of signal intelligence communication security. Serves as the cryptologic advisor to the operational commander and provides Special Security Officer assistance as required. Maintains special intelligence circuits. Maintains special intelligence and Order of Battle files. Manages and provides guidance to the intelligence and electronic warfare divisions. Team Lead for US Navy visit, board, search and seizure (VBSS) reaction force conducting boarding operations of vessels in international water to deter terrorists that utilize the world's oceans to traffic illegal weapons and other contraband and to deter human trafficking.

description: Operates receiving and recording equipment; identifies call signs and encrypted call signs; types messages received; knows operating and procedure signals; identifies natural and man made radio interference; recognizes and records unusual radio wave activity; handles magnetic tapes and makes recordings; maintains files, records, logs and publications. Is familiar with various systems for direction finding; loads and operates data processing computers. Designs plans for intercept coverage; has knowledge of the geographical, political and economic characteristics of target area; drafts status reports. Supervises the preparation and conduct of support operations in the area of information collection; prepares plans for signal security; supervises and evaluates subordinates; prepares written evaluation reports; prepares reports of significant activities; drafts security reports and other reports as required; identifies communication circuits required for specific geographical areas.

description: Operates receiving and recording equipment; identifies call signs and encrypted call signs; types messages received; knows operating and procedure signals; identifies natural and man made radio interference; recognizes and records unusual radio wave activity; handles magnetic tapes and makes recordings; maintains files, records, logs and publications. Is familiar with various systems for direction finding; loads and operates data processing computers. Designs plans for intercept coverage; has knowledge of the geographical, political and economic characteristics of target area; drafts status reports. Supervises the preparation and conduct of support operations in the area of information collection; prepares plans for signal security; supervises and evaluates subordinates; prepares written evaluation reports; prepares reports of significant activities; drafts security reports and other reports as required; identifies communication circuits required for specific geographical areas. Operates the AN/WLQ-4(V) Direct Support System

description: Directly responsible for the definition of cyber security strategy, policy, and concept of operations development for the NextGen air transportation system. Conducted a comprehensive study of aviation cyber governance, policy, and doctrine. Identified shortfalls and defined an interagency strategy for NextGen aviation cyber. Briefed results to FAA Deputy Administrator and senior officials from the Department of Homeland Security, Department of Defense, Office of the Director of National Intelligence, National Aeronautics and Space Administration, and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration. Defined first ever interagency aviation cyber evaluation study (ACES) and tabletop exercise. Both approved for action by FAA Deputy Administrator. o ACES is focused on the identification of vulnerabilities or potential weaknesses in aviation systems, but more importantly, serves as a first of its kind interagency activity focused on collaboratively and actively proposing specific mitigation or potential R&D needed to address identified gaps. o Tabletop includes participants from FAA, DoD, and DHS and exercises cyber reporting and command and control of aviation assets in response to various cyber scenarios.

description: Defined/directed research with the Air Force and Army Surgeon General's office on cyber based suicide detection. Research results present a novel natural language processing (NLP) tool to aid in the identification of emotions in cyber text. Led research effort with the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and Lockheed Martin on mapping critical infrastructure on to virtual ranges for the purposes of security assessment and evaluation. Results demonstrate the ability to instrument networks using low cost, passive sensors.

description: Director, DCOM-Army G6 and Senior advisor to the Afghan National Army (ANA) Director of Communications Engineered a $42M strategic and tactical communication solution for the ANA to provide mission critical command and control communications as well as secure intelligence dissemination and collection. Resultant architecture will save the Afghans over $15M a year while ensuring resilient and redundant data and communications exist at all echelons. Provided communication packages and situational awareness to/for 1,400 personnel at austere and remote DCOM-A locations throughout Afghanistan Senior advisor to the ANA Director of Communications on generation, sustainment and employment of all ANA Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (C4ISR ) Defined and directed over $700M in training and equipment for ANA communications requirements and budget for 2012-2018

description: Deputy program manager and technical lead for the National Cyber Range initiative; $130M Comprehensive National Cybersecurity Initiative (CNCI) directed program to build the architecture and software tools for a secure, self-contained testing capability to rapidly emulate large-scale complex networks that match the depth and diversity of real-world networks. Lead researcher to define a DARPA program concept based on fundamentally secure cyber physical systems (CPS); Cyber Physical Assurance and Resilience (CYPHAR). Program earmarked for FY2013 funding with an initial budget of $9M.

description: Managed a team of 14 to 17 technicians in day to day operations in the South NOC for T-Mobile. I motivated and lead the DDS team to complete network goals and assist in the individual growth of team members in the skill needed in the DDS role. I prioritized and escalated all issues internally and externally sourced. Verified circuit delivery on wireless voice and data networks thru multiple transmission mediums RFC tested and turned up cell sites while documenting all procedures to enhance and speed up the time required to turn up a cell site, while eliminating duplicated work orders and effort Used programs such as: Homer, Citrix, Granite, ALU SAM 5620, NetExpert, PuTTY manager, Insite, Microsoft Outlook, Excel, including experience with pivot tables, Word, Sliped, IPControl Daily Processing up to 1,400 work orders, trouble tickets as well as creating trouble tickets and tasks when needed for alarmed cell sites, or contacted switch operators and field technicians to troubleshoot the alarm Programmed, tested, troubleshoot, provisioned, pushed operating system firmware upgrades, verified configurations, checked alarm functions monitoring, and supported multiple devices including, ALU 7705 and 7750 routers, Cisco 7609 routers, JDSU Collector, MSO and site NID's, and JDSU QT600 test heads Utilized the CLI and/or the GUI to configure and test ALU 7705, 7750's and JDSU NID's Contacted vendors and equipment manufactures to create trouble tickets for repair of sites, equipment, VLAN's and cabling Troubleshoot problems with devices, connections, VLAN's, broadcast storms, vendors or other service or none-service impacting situations Trained NOC personnel in live site reprovisioning of cell site NIDs Assisted Field techs in restoring 2G & 3G service to cell sites Experienced in troubleshooting microwave, COW, and COLT cell sites for high priority events

description: â€¢ Issued SIGINT reports to national level consumers as a Signals Intelligence Analyst/Product Reporter â€¢ Conducted research, in-depth analysis, and writing of over 100 time-sensitive KLIEGLIGHTS, over 80 mission specific reports, and contributed to over 260 reports that received executive, senior, or presidential level feedback â€¢ Trained two new personnel that achieved a score of 100% on the Job Qualification Readiness (JQR) reporting evaluation (Training included daily use, memorization, and understanding of all current USSIDs and reporting programs specifically CPE and MESSIAH) â€¢ Provided real time direct threat warnings to support CENTCOM and PACOM missions â€¢ Program manager for a team of three multi-service individuals on shift for real time collection Direct Threat Warning (DTW) missions and multiple other mission requirements â€¢ Developed and maintained multiple target databases â€¢ Pioneered mission use and trained 95% of mission team on the use of GALE-Lite to improve analytical skills and mission effectiveness. â€¢ Daily prepared and delivered mission briefings to NSA Senior Leadership â€¢ Daily usage of Intelligence analyst tools, USSIDâ€™s, and databases including, but not limited to; ANALYSTâ€™S NOTEBOOK, PINWALE, CPE, MESSIAH, GALE-LITE, HOMEBASE, CADENCE, ArcGIS, ARCVIEW, SEDB, DISHFIRE, MAINWAY, TAPERLAY, RENOIR, OCTAVE, ANCHORY/MAUI, AIRGAP, AMHS, INTELINK, UIS, CONTRACTIVE, GEOFINDER, GOOGLE EARTH, and OILSTOCK, Microsoft Office 2007, Outlook, Word, Power Point, and Excel including experience with pivot tables

description: Signal Processing/Analyst Signals analyst and member of cryptologic collection system team responsible for analysis, processing and correlation of sensitive information for Government customers. Designated as the operational focal point between customer, system developer and three operational field sites for a new signals processing and analysis collection suite. Deputy Operations Chief for Special Source Operations Division As Deputy Operations Chief for the Special Source Operations, lead and directed a unique and diverse division within the NSA Signals Intelligence Directorate. Promulgated operational policies, collection and reporting requirements; supervised and managed 65+ personnel in the delivery of SIGINT product to Target Offices of Primary Interest (TOPIs). Direct Support Operations Chief; EP-3E Aircrewman Cryptologic Technician Operator/Analyst As Direct Support Operations Chief, managed three diverse work centers covering Manual Morse and Special Signals disciplines. Accomplished 100 percent deployment requirements while leading and managing 35+ Sailors in support of Fleet Air Reconnaissance Squadron ONE (VQ-1) and Commander, SEVENTH Fleet. Accrued over 900 flight hours in the performance of in-flight functions as a Cryptologic Operator and Analyst onboard EP-3E (ARIES II) aircraft in support of National Intelligence and Fleet Cryptologic (afloat and airborne) Collection requirements

description: Served as language analyst within the Signals Intelligence Directorate, translating/transcribing foreign language voice and graphic materials. Scanned raw intelligence data and performed research and analysis of material to determine significance/reportability; performed signals research and target development for high-interest entities. Oversaw quality control of two language analyst teams, ensuring timeliness and accuracy of information in direct support of local- and national-level decision makers. Authored, reviewed, and edited time-sensitive intelligence reports for use by national-level decision makers and theater commanders.
